definition: to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up

sentences.english: Temperatures over 44 degrees C (110 degrees F) made clambering down the steep slopes arduous.
sentences.chinese: 由於氣溫超過44℃，因此由陡坡攀爬下山非常費力。

sentences.english: But that compromises the artistic side of climbing.
sentences.chinese: 但是這種行爲削減了攀爬的藝術性。

sentences.english: Animals use their claws or talons to catch prey, climb trees, and defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 動物使用爪子來捕獲獵物，攀爬樹木和自我防禦。

sentences.english: Children as young as two toddle in and climb the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 兩歲左右的孩童蹣跚地走進教室，攀爬樓梯。

sentences.english: As he clambered over the railings he grinned at Manuel.
sentences.chinese: 在他攀爬翻過圍欄時他對曼紐爾咧嘴笑了笑。

sentences.english: The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人攀爬這條峻峭的上坡路有困難。

sentences.english: The climber must be able to complete the climbing without taking a rest on the rope.
sentences.chinese: 攀爬者必須能夠在沒有休息的情況下完成攀爬。

sentences.english: The climber must be able to complete the climbing without taking a rest on the rope.
sentences.chinese: 攀爬者必須能夠在沒有休息的情況下完成攀爬。

sentences.english: He chanced climbing the cliff without a safety belt.
sentences.chinese: 他冒險不繫安全帶去攀爬峭壁。

sentences.english: For a bunch of 8 and 9 year-olds, it's a tough climb.
sentences.chinese: 對一羣八九歲的孩子來說，這是一場艱難的攀爬。

sentences.english: The backstage activities are a mysterious world for this youngster.
sentences.chinese: 綵樓背後的戲棚是孩童攀爬窺探的神祕世界。

sentences.english: When lions climb, their ankles slide sideways under their body weight.
sentences.chinese: 在獅子攀爬時，它們的腳踝在體重作用下向側面滑動。

sentences.english: I was really impressed with some of the routes that Abon had done in Yangshuo.
sentences.chinese: 阿邦在陽朔攀爬的一些線路讓我印象非常深刻。

sentences.english: Caves at Yanwoling in Hainan; the bamboo scaffolding was built by villagers to enter the caves.
sentences.chinese: 嶺上的巖洞，巖壁上爲村民用以攀爬進入洞穴之竹棚。

sentences.english: Then they scrambled round the rocks to the other side of the house.
sentences.chinese: 然後他們攀爬過岩石到屋子的另一邊去。

definition: to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
